explains: n. 骚乱，动荡；（空气或水的）湍流，紊流
wordGroup: atmospheric turbulence 大气湍流；湍馏气
turbulence intensity 湍流强度；扰动强度

sentences.en: The 1960s and early 1970s were a time of change and turbulence.
sentences.cn: 20世纪60年代和70年代初期是个变革和动荡的年代。

sentences.en: The plane encountered severe turbulence and winds of nearly two-hundred miles an hour.
sentences.cn: 那架飞机遇到了强湍流和时速近二百英里的强风。

sentences.en: On the other hand, air turbulence increases because of the effect of skyscrapers on airflow.
sentences.cn: 另一方面，摩天大楼对气流的影响导致了空气湍流增加。
